entities.name: Articque
entities.description: A specialist provider of Location Intelligence (LI) analytics solutions, Articque is a pure-play software platform provider focused on unlocking critical insights from geo-data analysis. Its pure-play and best-of-breed approach has propelled the company into the top-3 LI platform providers in France.
keyStrengths: decades of experience in developing innovative geospatial data-led solutions
cloud-based, powerful and scalable LI Platform
unique proprietary no-code modeling approach
Sound adjusted EBITDA margin
Favorable net dollar retention
solid stand-alone and compelling business plan
platform able to accommodate any analytics or business intelligence use case where location-related data support strategic decision-making
ability to convert, retain and upsell its customer base
Direct go-to-market approach
Land & expand model for new clients
High sales conversion ratio (>55% on active pitches)
New logo generation
Client nurturing
well-honed two-pronged sales and marketing execution
strict and comprehensive IT and Data security plan
highest grade in security audit by SSL247
Positioned as a challenger to the large players
Offers an affordable superior functional coverage
Has a strong client portfolio established for over 30 years
Has a strong footprint in the private sector compared to some competitors
Increasing recurring revenues
Successful switch of business model leading to high recurring billings
Continue the M2S switch on the AP client base
Continued upselling effort on the existing client base and focus on repeat business
New logo acquisition
Anticipates to gain market share following favorable movements of the competitive environment
entities.growthStrategySummary: expects its recurring billings to show consistent y-o-y growth of ~25% to reach €5.3m in FY24BP (85% of total billings), generating a 49% adjusted EBITDA margin in FY24BP, driven by: The completion of M2S transition of AP, The completion of the migration of CDD clients to CDO, The ramp-up of CDO & AP subscription offering to new clients, The Development and launch of two additional modules: DataComposer, DataViz

entities.characteristics: Articque is positioned as a challenger to large players. Competitors include Esri, Spectrum Spatial, Ciril Group, Geoconcept, MapInfo, Smappen. Positioning based on Price Level (Low/High) and Functional Coverage (Low/High).
entities.growthInfo: expected to reach $51.3Bn by 2030 growing at a 15.6% CAGR over the period
keyDrivers: Augmented analytics for even better business outcomes
technology has considerably improved to increasingly allow non-technical users to access LI tools opening a vast field of untapped potential
Refine customer knowledge through geospatial insights
Leverage operational and execution excellence through more accurate decision making
Enhance business data intelligence by bringing geography into business data
Improve grasp and awareness of business environment by blending multiple data sources
Massive volume of real time location data generated by the ubiquity of smartphones, mobile and business applications
Increasing number of business intelligence and analytics tools supporting location data analysis
Greater interest and awareness from corporations in using location data to accurately identify consumer behavior
Technology maturing with innovative features to be used within organizations
Growing level of criticality assigned to several use cases of location intelligence platforms
Considerable democratization of LI applications shifting from restricted areas for technical experts to becoming accessible by any business user

All staff previously employed under Groupe Articque Solutions transferred to Articque Informatique.
Transition towards a SaaS business model, impacting revenue nature.
Miscellaneous revenue significantly dropped from €160k in FY18A to €54k in FY22L. It should remain negligible from FY23 onwards
Non-recurring revenues of AP continuously decreased linked to the change in business model favouring subscription over perpetual licenses
Legacy licenses, residuals of former product CDD, are expected to die out completely in FY23BP
Consulting revenues declined by €200k in FY22L, caused by the two-year development cycle of large projects and by the recent switch towards recurring Consulting package promoted by Articque
